Class Bomb

java.lang.Object
com.game.models.entities.Bomb
public class Bomb extends Object
Represents a bomb entity in the game. Handles the placement, explosion, and visual effects of the bomb, as well as player damage and potential power-up generation after destroying breakable tiles.

    Constructs a Bomb object with necessary map data and game references.

  • Constructor Details

    • Bomb

      public Bomb(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane mapGrid, char[][] mapData, javafx.scene.layout.StackPane[][] tiles, javafx.scene.image.Image emptyImg, List<Player> players, GameMapController controller)
      Constructs a Bomb object with necessary map data and game references.
      Parameters:
      mapGrid - The GridPane representing the game map.
      mapData - A 2D char array representing tile types on the map.
      tiles - A 2D array of StackPanes representing each map tile.
      emptyImg - The image used for empty (cleared) tiles.
      players - A list of players in the game.
      controller - Reference to the GameMapController for interaction.

  • Method Details

    • place

      public void place(int row, int col)
      Places a bomb at the specidsfied grid location and schedules its explosion.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index on the map.
      col - The column index on the map.

    • setRange

      public void setRange(int range)
      Sets the explosion range of the bomb. Don't allow negative or null value
      Parameters:
      range - The number of tiles the explosion will extend.

    • getRange

      public int getRange()
      Gets the current explosion range of the bomb.
      Returns:
      The number of tiles the explosion will extend.

    • getOriginalRange

      public static int getOriginalRange()
      Gets the default explosion range.
      Returns:
      The default explosion range.

    • getCOOLDOWN_SECONDS

      public static double getCOOLDOWN_SECONDS()
      Gets the cooldown period (in seconds) for placing another bomb.
      Returns:
      Cooldown time in seconds.

    • getActiveBombs

      public List<PlacedBomb> getActiveBombs()
      Returns a copy of the list of bombs currently active on the map.
      Returns:
      A new list containing active PlacedBomb objects.
